isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9200, 9300, 9400 Models Built After January 1, 1995 - ELECTRICAL TROUBLESHOOTING LIGHT SYSTEMS - OPERATION - DAYTIME RUNNING LIGHTS (DRL) RELAY WIRING-CANADA

svcproc.title: DAYTIME RUNNING LIGHTS (DRL) RELAY WIRING-CANADA
svcproc.para: This circuitry is for daytime running lights on trucks running in Canada. If the headlight switch is turned OFF on the truck, and the ignition switch is turned to accessories or the (ignition) position, the daytime running lights will come ON when the park brake is released. This allows current to flow from A3 accessory adapter (501) through circuit 12R, fuse F10-A, circuit 66A, DRL day relay coil, circuit 66D, DRL park brake switch (468), Circuit 66E, DRL night relay contacts, circuit 68-GC, 66-GB, and 66-G to ground adapter (453). Note DRL night relay (151) also has fog lights disabled until headlight switch is turned ON. This disables daytime running lights and enables fog light circuitry.
